title: Lifting a Rod

children.value:
A non-uniform rod of mass 
$\valuedef{m}{200}{kg}$
 and length 
$\valuedef{l}{10.0}{m}$
 has its centre of mass 
$\valuedef{d}{4.0}{m}$
 from one end. It is supported horizontally by two vertical ropes which are attached to points 
$\valuedef{s}{1.0}{m}$
 from each end.

answer.value:
The tensions in the ropes are 
$\valuedef{T_{1}}{735}{N}$
 and 
$\valuedef{T_{2}}{1225}{N}$

children.value: Calculate the tension in each rope.

The rod is raised by accelerating it at 
$\valuedef{a}{0.20}{m\,  s\sup {-2}}$
 to a speed 
$\valuedef{v}{0.60}{m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
, which remains constant until the total height gained is 
$\valuedef{h}{12.0}{m}$
.

answer.value:
The total of the tensions in the ropes when the rod is accelerating is 
$\valuedef{T_{tot}}{2000}{N}$
.

children.value: Calculate the sum of the tensions in the ropes when the rod is accelerating

answer.value:
The total of the tensions in the ropes when the rod is moving at a constant speed is 
$\valuedef{T_{tot}}{1960}{N}$
.

children.value: Calculate the sum of the tensions in the ropes when the rod is moving up at a steady speed

answer.value:
The power required when lifting the rod at 
$\vari{v}$
 is 
$\valuedef{P}{1176}{W}$
.

children.value:
Calculate the power required when lifting the rod at 
$\vari{v}$

answer.value:
The distance moved whilst accelerating is 
$\valuedef{s_{1}}{0.9}{m}$
, and that moved whilst at a constant speed is 
$\valuedef{s_{2}}{11.1}{m}$
.

children.value:
Calculate the distance for which the rod was accelerating and the distance for which it moved at 
$\vari{v}$

answer.value:
The work done while raising the rod is 
$\valuedef{W}{\frac{1}{2}mv^{2} + mgh}{}$
. This is the sum of the kinetic and gravitational potential energy the rod gained as it was lifted.

children.value:
Using the above, or otherwise, find the work done raising the rod in terms of 
$\vari{m}$
, 
$\vari{v}$
 and 
$\vari{h}$
. Comment on the value.
